title: Out of This World Turkey Brine Recipe
description: This turkey brine recipe makes a juicy, flavorful turkey. It's easy to make with water, salt, brown sugar, Worcestershire, garlic, and pepper.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Meat and Poultry Turkey Brine Out of This World Turkey Brine 4.8 (861) 667 Reviews 36 Photos This turkey brine recipe is the best around. Use before smoking or roasting your turkey. My uncle gave me this recipe; he is an avid meat smoker. Submitted by SUDEMERS Updated on October 18, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 36 36 36 36 Prep Time: 10 mins Total Time: 10 mins Servings: 12 Yield: 34 cups Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 12 servings 2 gallons water 1 ½ cups canning salt ⅓ cup brown sugar ¼ cup Worcestershire sauce 3 tablespoons minced garlic 1 tablespoon ground black pepper Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Mix water, salt, brown sugar, Worcestershire sauce, garlic, and pepper together in a food-grade bucket or container large enough to hold your turkey. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Carefully submerge turkey in brine. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Cover and store in the refrigerator. Soak for two days before smoking or roasting. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios From the Editor Always brine foods in a food-grade, nonreactive container such as a stainless steel or enameled stockpot, a brining bag, or a food-grade plastic bucket. Never use household trash bags, plastic trash cans, metal buckets, or containers not meant for food use. This recipe uses canning or kosher salt, not table salt. Using table salt in this amount will make the brine too salty. I Made It Print 1,547 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Out of This World Turkey Brine 01 of 36 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 36 Photo by  Ms Q 02/09/2024 A keeper! Best ever brine just the way it is! That's all and that's it! 03 of 36 Photo by  DapperApple7911 11/22/2022 4 for simplicity. We shall see how the turkey smokes in 2 days!Could not find any canning salt, so halved the amount using coarse Himalayan pink salt. Will let you know how it comes out. Warmed the water to tepid so the salt would dissolve. Was about 2 spots under pasta water, so think I'm good. 04 of 36 Photo by  Trusted Brands 11/16/2021 05 of 36 Photo by  Bob Lees 11/26/2020 06 of 36 Photo by  Corey 01/01/2020 07 of 36 Photo by  Jen Royce 12/01/2019 08 of 36 Photo by  JRiley 01/06/2019 Followed recipe exactly- brined 2 days, rinsed and smoked...SO good!!! (14lb smoked about 4 hours) 09 of 36 Photo by  Melissa Gaslin 11/22/2018 Delicious! Best turkey recipe I've ever tried. I followed the recipe and roasted it in the oven. 500° for 30 min and then 350° until done. It was a big hit! 10 of 36 Photo by  Lisa Bee 06/04/2018 Wow.. just wow! YUMALICIOUS! So easy to put together! We had everything on hand to mix it up!! We soaked (in the fridge) a turkey breast for 13 hrs. Hickory smoked for 1:45 min and finished in the oven at 325*. We use a meat thermometer (with temp alarm) so I can't tell you exact times on the cooking. OFF THE CHARTS deeelish! It was soooo MOIST and not salty! Followed the recipe to the T.. no changes or substitutions made. This one went into the book!! PS~. It's not burned. I put a rub on it prior to putting it in the oven. 1 2 3 4 Next You’ll Also Love Mighty Fine Turkey Brine 4 Ratings Citrus Turkey Brine 289 Ratings Turkey Brine 1,381 Ratings Grandma's Farmhouse Turkey Brine 51 Ratings Orange Turkey Brine 75 Ratings Incredible Turkey Brine 17 Ratings Maple Turkey Brine 66 Ratings Annie's Turkey Brine 6 Ratings Apple Brine for Turkey the Night Before Cooking 84 Ratings Simple Turkey Brine 30 Ratings Apple Cider Turkey Brine 18 Ratings Orange, Tea, Bourbon-Brined Paprika Butter Turkey 7 Ratings Savory Turkey Brine 38 Ratings Easy Citrus Turkey Brine 3 Ratings Holiday Turkey Brine 4 Ratings Peppered Maple and Thyme Turkey Brine 1 Rating Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
